briefTitle: Dose Response Effects of Marine Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Inflammation
officialTitle: Dose Response Effects of Marine Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Inflammation

interventions.name: Eicosapentaenoic Acid and Docosahexaenoic Acid (EPA + DHA)

summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the lowest effective dose of EPA + DHA (300, 600, 900 and 1,800 mg/day delivered as fish oil supplements) that significantly attenuates the inflammatory response to in vivo and ex vivo endotoxin challenge as measured by the production over time of several inflammatory markers.

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Concentrations of Inflammatory Markers (TNF-alpha and IL-6) Following 5 Months of Treatment
